item.title: Saudi Arabia cements ties with Sudan during Burhan visit as UAE rivalry heats up
item.description: The Sudanese leader may be looking to increase Saudi support following losses on the battlefield as Riyadh weighs its security interests in the country.

item.title: Will deadly Palmyra attack accelerate SDF's integration into Syrian forces?
item.description: Following the Palmyra attack, analysts say the SDF may face growing pressure to align with Damascus.

item.title: Pentagon identifies two US Army soldiers killed in Syria attack
item.description: Syria's government said it arrested five people on Sunday following the attack that killed three Americans and wounded several others, but it has offered no clarity about how the gunman was able to approach what should have been a secure meeting.

item.title: Yemen's main separatist group says it launched military operation in Abyan
item.description:
DUBAI, Dec ​15 (Reuters) - ​Yemen's ⁠main separatist group, the ​Southern ‍Transitional ​Council, said they ⁠have launched a military operation ​in ⁠southern ⁠Abyan province.

The STC has ‌recently ​claimed broad control of ‍Southern Yemen.

(Reporting ‌by ‌Ahmed Elimam; Editing by ⁠Sharon Singleton)

item.title: ICC rejects Israeli bid to halt Gaza war investigation
item.description:
THE HAGUE, Dec 15 (Reuters) - Appeals judges at the ​International Criminal Court (ICC) on Monday ​rejected one in a series of legal challenges brought ⁠by Israel against the court's probe into its conduct of theGaza war.

On appeal, judges refused to overturn a ​lower court decision that the prosecution's investigation ‍into alleged crimes under its ​jurisdiction could include events following the deadly attack on Israel by militant Palestinian group Hamas on October 7, 2023.

item.title: In Israel, Sydney attack casts shadow over Hanukkah
item.description:
With heavy hearts, Jews in Israel lit the year's first Hanukkah candles, mourning after gunmen opened fire on a Jewish gathering in Australia, killing 15 and reviving painful memories of the October 7, 2023 attack.

Sunday's attack in Bondi Beach was Australia's worst mass shooting in decades, and has been decried as antisemitic "terrorism" by Israeli authorities and many others around the world.

item.title: Ahmed al-Ahmed, Syrian Australian who fought off Hanukkah attackers, recovering from surgery
item.description: Ahmed is recovering from surgery after being injured while tackling one of the shooters during an attack on a Jewish gathering in Australia, as he receives an outpouring of support for his actions.

item.title: Egypt secures Qatari investment boost, launches first SCZONE industrial deal
item.description: Bilateral trade between the two countries rose to $143 million during the first 10 months of 2025.
